User 1: In all applications, the bank is required to create at least one offer.
User 2: Creating an offer is a mandatory step in the loan application process.
User 3: It is not possible to have applications without any offers created.

User 1: An application cannot be submitted more than once.
User 2: Submitting an application cannot occur multiple times.
User 3: We cannot have applications that are submitted more than once.

User 1: Pending status of an application means that the application is approved and it cannot occur multiple times.
User 2: We may have a maximum of one application pending event.
User 3: Application pending is a possible final outcome for an application and we can only have one outcome for each application.

User 1: Pending and cancelled status cannot occur at the same time.
User 2: One application can have only one of the outcomes: pending or cancelled.
User 3: Cancellation and pending of an application can never occur together for an individual.

User 1: Cancellation and denial of an application are final outcomes, and only one of them can occur for an individual.
User 2: An application can either be cancelled or denied.
User 3: It should not be possible to have both cancellation and denial of an application.

User 1: An offer can be sent either online only or both online and via mail.
User 2: There are two possible sending procedures for offers: 1) mail and online 2) only online.
User 3: It is not possible to have an application with both events: offer sent online and offer sent via mail and online.

User 1: It is not allowed to create an offer after an application is cancelled.
User 2: When an application is cancelled, no more offer should be created for this application.
User 3: Creation of offers after the cancellation of an application is impossible.

User 1: We cannot have the acceptance of an application after an offer is created.
User 2: Acceptance of an application never occurs after the creation of an offer.
User 3: It is not allowed to have the acceptance of an application after the first offer has been created.

User 1: If an application is in pending, there must be an accepted offer beforehand.
User 2: All pending applications must precede an accepted offer.
User 3: It should not be possible to have a pending application without first having an offer accepted.

User 1: We cannot have an incomplete status for an application without validating it first.
User 2: Any application incomplete event must proceede the validation of the application.
User 3: Validation of an application should occur prior to deciding any incompleteness in the application.

User 1: Making a decision is a mandatory action in this process.
User 2: We cannot have cases without a decision.
User 3: All the applications must have a decision.

User 1: Withdrawing the case cannot occur more than once.
User 2: Each application can be withdrawn a maximum of one time.
User 3: We cannot have multiple withdrawals within the same application.

User 1: Mail income and mail valid both must exist in all individual applications.
User 2: The activities mail valid and mail income occur together in all cases.
User 3: We cannot have mail income without mail valid, and vice versa.

User 1: Only one of the activities withdrawal and revoke decision can occur in a case.
User 2: We cannot have both revoking a decision and withdrawal of the application in one case.
User 3: If a decision is revoked, it cannot be withdrawn, and vice versa.

User 1: The farmers cannot revoke the decision after the payment is finished.
User 2: Revoking a decision after finalizing the payment is not allowed.
User 3: No revoke decision can occur after finishing the payment.

User 1: We cannot begin editing when a decision is made.
User 2: Begin edition should not be permitted after making a decision.
User 3: After making a decision, no editing should begin.

User 1: It is not possible to revoke a decision without making a decision first.
User 2: In order to have revoking of a decision, it is necessary to have a decision made in the process.
User 3: All revoke decisions should be preceded by a decision.

User 1: If documents are inserted, payment should also begin in each case.
User 2: Inserting documents in an application implies that payment has begun before or will begin after it.
User 3: Applications with insertion of documents have begin payment as well.

User 1: Any mail income should be followed by some calculations.
User 2: If mail income is recorded, we should have calculations at some point after it.
User 3: It is not possible to have mail income without some calculations after it.

User 1: If a payment is aborted, it should be finished at some point after it.
User 2: Aborting a payment should be followed by finish editing.
User 3: Any aborted payment will eventually have finish payment.

User 1: We cannot have any claim without a receive claim event.
User 2: All the claims must be received first.
User 3: Receiving a claim is a mandatory step in the process.

User 1: We cannot have multiple rejections for a single claim.
User 2: Rejection of a claim may occur at most once.
User 3: It is impossible to have claims with multiple rejections.

User 1: First type of receive objection and repayment always occur together in a claim.
User 2: It is not possible to have claims with only repayment or only receiving an objection from the first type.
User 3: Repayment without receiving the first objection is impossible, and vice versa.

User 1: One claim can be either accepted or rejected.
User 2: We cannot have claims that are both accepted and rejected.
User 3: If a claim is accepted, it cannot be rejected and vice versa.

User 1: First and second blocking mechanisms cannot occur together.
User 2: A claim may have block claim 1 or 2, but not both of them.
User 3: A claim is either blocked with the first type of blocking or the second type, and not both.

User 1: We cannot have payment order and repayment in any order. No payment can happen after a repayment.
User 2: After repaying the received benefits, there should be no payment order.
User 3: Placing a payment order after the repayment should not be allowed.

User 1: We cannot execute a payment without first placing an order for the payment.
User 2: All executions of payments must be preceded by a payment order.
User 3: We need to first place a payment order before executing any payment.

User 1: Correction of claims is only possible if the claim is already blocked with the first blocking mechanism.
User 2: All claim corrections must precede a block claim 1.
User 3: We cannot have any correct claim without a block claim type 1 before it.

User 1: If a claim is withdrawn, it should be blocked with mechanism 3 as well.
User 2: Occurrence of withdraw claim is allowed only if block claim 3 also exists.
User 3: Withdraw claim must always coexist with the third type of blocking.

User 1: All the accepted claims should have a payment order afterward.
User 2: The model allows for ordering a payment without accepting the claim; that is not possible.
User 3: We cannot have accepted claims without any payment order after it.

User 1: If a claim is unblocked with type three, then a payment order must occur afterward.
User 2: It is not possible to have the third unblocking mechanism event without any payment order occurring after it.
User 3: Unblocking claims with the third mechanism must be followed by a payment order.
